en.translation: The occurrence and development of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way
en.example_sentence: Finding this book in the library was pure serendipity
en.example_translation: Encontrar este libro en la biblioteca fue pura serendipia
en.etymology: From the Persian fairy tale The Three Princes of Serendip
en.cultural_note: A word coined by Horace Walpole in 1754

en.translation: Lasting for a very short time
en.example_sentence: The beauty of cherry blossoms is ephemeral
en.example_translation: La belleza de los cerezos en flor es efímera
en.etymology: From Greek ephēmeros 'lasting only one day'
en.cultural_note: Often used in art and nature contexts

en.example_sentence: Her wanderlust led her to explore remote corners of the world
en.example_translation: Su pasión por viajar la llevó a explorar rincones remotos del mundo
en.cultural_note: Reflects the human desire for exploration and discovery

es.example_sentence: La mariposa voló por el jardín
es.example_translation: The butterfly flew through the garden
es.cultural_note: Often symbolizes transformation in Latin American culture

es.example: Me despierto en la madrugada para estudiar

es.translation: time spent at the table after finishing a meal
es.example_sentence: La sobremesa duró más que la cena
es.example_translation: The after-dinner conversation lasted longer than dinner
es.cultural_note: An important social custom in Spanish-speaking countries

es.translation: a quality of passion and inspiration
es.example_sentence: El bailaor de flamenco tiene mucho duende
es.example_translation: The flamenco dancer has great spirit and charm
es.etymology: From 'dueño' (owner), originally meaning a magical creature
es.cultural_note: Essential concept in flamenco and Spanish arts

fr.example: Le papillon vole dans le jardin.
Le bonheur est dans les petites choses.
L'aube se lève sur la ville.

fr.translation: the feeling of being in a foreign place
fr.example_sentence: Le dépaysement total lors de mon premier voyage à Tokyo
fr.example_translation: The complete feeling of displacement during my first trip to Tokyo
fr.cultural_note: Unique French concept with no direct English equivalent

fr.example: J'aime flâner dans les rues de Paris

de.example: Der Schmetterling fliegt durch den Garten.
Die Freude war in ihren Augen zu sehen.

de.translation: feeling homesick for a place you've never been to
de.example_sentence: Sie hat Fernweh nach den Bergen
de.example_translation: She longs for the mountains she's never visited
de.cultural_note: Reflects German romantic ideals of travel and exploration

ja.example_sentence: 木漏れ日が森の中で踊っている
ja.example_translation: Sunlight is dancing through the trees in the forest
ja.cultural_note: Reflects Japanese appreciation for subtle natural beauty
